document.docAuthor: Brescovit, Antonio Domingos & Ruiz, Gustavo Rodrigo Sanches
document.docTitle: Antillorena patapata Brescovit & Ruiz, 2011, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Antillorena Jocqué 1991 from northeastern Brazil (Araneae, Zodariidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Antillorena Jocqué 1991 from northeastern Brazil (Araneae, Zodariidae)

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 1 – 3. Antillorena patapata sp. nov. 1 male (Holotype, IBSP 160903), dorsal view; 2 – 3 female (Paratype, IBSP 160906); 2 dorsal view, 3 carapace, lateral view.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 4 – 5. Antillorena patapata sp. nov. (Paratype, IBSP 160904). 4 female carapace and chelicerae, frontal view; 5 female labium, endites, sternum and coxae, ventral view.
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURES 6. Antillorena patapata sp. nov., left male palp, expanded (UEFS). Abbreviations: BH: basal hematodocha; Co: conductor; Cy: cymbium; E: embolus; P: projection of cymbium; PTA: proximal tegular apophysis; RTA: retrolateral tibial apophysis; St: subtegulum; T: tegulum; VTA: ventral tegular apophysis.
figureCitation.captionText-3: FIGURES 7 – 10. Antillorena patapata sp. nov. 7 – 8 left male palp (IBSP 160903), (7 ventral view, 8 retrolateral view); 9 – 10 female (IBSP 160906), (9 epigynum, ventral view, 10 vulva, dorsal view). Abbreviations: A: atrium; CD: copulation duct; Co: conductor; E: embolus; FD: fertilization duct; LD: lateral depression; MA: median apophysis; MS: median septum; P: projection of cymbium; Po: pocket; PTA: proximal tegular apophysis; Sp: spermatheca; VTA: ventral tegular apophysis.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. Holotype :
male from Serra de São José (
12 º07’S
,
39 º03’W
), Maria Quitéria District, Feira de Santana, Bahia, Brazil ,
Aug. 2009
–
Aug. 2010
, G. da S.C. Ferreira col., deposited in IBSP
160903
.
Paratypes :
two males and three females with same data ( UEFS ; IBSP
160904 – 160906
).

Other material examined. BRAZIL . Bahia : Feira de Santana, Maria Quitéria District, Serra de São José (
12 º07’S
,
39 º03’W
),
Aug. 2009
–
Aug. 2010
, G. da S. C. Ferreira col. ( 2 #m UEFS ; 7 #m, 1 #f IBSP
160908 – 160914
).

Etymology. The specific name, to be treated as a Latin noun in apposition, is derived from a word in Portuguese and means a regional name for comb. This name refers to the slender projections present on the median apophysis.

Description. Male ( holotype ).
Total length 8.2 . Prosoma 4.5 long, 3.0 wide. Carapace pear-shaped, brown, highest at the fovea region in profile (
Fig. 1
); tegument smooth and shiny. Chelicerae brown. Labium triangular, orange-brown. Endites orange-brown, apices white. Sternum brown, with median longitudinal yellow band, anteriorly truncated, posterior margin not projected between coxae IV. Legs with ventral face of coxae and femora yellowish green, other segments greenish brown. Abdomen oval with no spines, dorsally with a pattern of light median chevrons and dorso-lateral light spots, distally with a large light spot; laterally brown and ventrally pale on borders and brownish medially (
Fig. 1
). Spinnerets orange-brown. Eye sizes and interdistances: ALE=PLE<AME=PME; AME 0.14 , ALE 0.18 , PME 0.14 , PLE 0.18 , AME-AME 0.06 , AME-ALE 0.08 , PME- PME 0.08 , PME-PLE 0.18 ; ALE-PLE 0.06 ; MOQ: 0.36 anterior width, 0.30 posterior width, 0.40 long. Leg formula: 4123 . Leg measurements: I: femur 2.5 / patella 1.3 / tibia 2.0/ metatarsus 1.8 / tarsus 1.0/ total 8.6 ; II: 2.3 / 1.2 / 1.5 / 1.5 / 0.9 / 7.4 / III: 2.0/ 0.9 / 1.0/ 1.7 / 0.9 / 6.5 / IV: 2.5 / 1.3 / 1.8 / 2.8 / 1.0/ 9.4 . Leg spination: I: femur p0- 0-1 ; tibia p0, r0, v0; metatarsus p0- 0-1 , r0,
v 1
p- 2 - 2 ; II: femur d0- 0-1 , tibia p0, r0, v 0-1 -0; metatarsus p0- 0-1 , r0,
v 1
r- 1 r- 2 ; III: femur d
1 v-
0-1 p, patela p 1 - 1 -0, d0- 0-1 , r 0-1 -0, tibia d 1 - 1 -0, p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 -0,
v 2 - 2
- 2 ; metatarsus d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1-2 , r 1 - 1- 2 ,
v 2 - 2
- 2 ; IV: femur d
1 v-
0-1 p, patela p 1 - 1 -0, d0- 0-1 , r 0-1 -0, tibia d 1 - 1 - 1 , p 1 - 1 - 1 , r 1 - 1 -0,
v 2 - 2
- 2 ; metatarsus d 1 - 1 - 1 -, p 1 - 1-2 , r 1 - 1-2 ,
v 2 - 2
- 2 . Palp: retrolateral tibial apophysis straight and long. Cymbium with a small retrolaterobasal projection and no dorsal furrow. Tegulum with a long, curved, proximal tegular apophysis and a ventral tegular apophysis; median apophysis long and curved, with large base not covered by tegulum, distally with a fringe of slender projections; hyaline and voluminous apical conductor, embolus S-shaped originating from proximal, retrolateral side (
Figs 6–8
).

Female ( Paratype IBSP
160904
).
Total length 9.8 . Prosoma 4.8 long, 4.2 wide. Coloration as in male, except sternum darker and abdomen darker with less spots (
Figs 2–5
). Eye sizes and interdistances: PLE>ALE=PME>AME; AME 0.14 , ALE 0.16 , PME 0.16 , PLE 0.18 , AME-AME 0.08 , AME-ALE 0.10 , PME- PME 0.08 , PME-PLE 0.22 , ALE-PLE 0.08 ; MOQ: 0.32 anterior width, 0.36 posterior width, 0.42 long. Leg formula: 4123 . Leg measurements: I: femur 2.6 / patella 1.3 / tibia 2.0/ metatarsus 1.7 / tarsus 1.0/ total 8.6 ; II: 2.4 / 1.2 / 1.6 / 1.7 / 1.0/ 7.9 / III: 2.0/ 1.0/ 1.2 / 1.8 / 0.9 / 6.9 / IV: 2.8 / 1.2 / 2.0/ 3.1 / 1.2 / 10.3 . Leg spination as in male, except: leg I: metatarsus
v 2 - 2
- 2 ; II: metatarsus
v 2 - 1
r- 2 . Epigynum with shallow lateral depressions, atrium oval, median septum triangular with two globose pockets (
Fig. 9
); internally, copulatory ducts with three coils, basal and elongated spermathecae and short and wide fertilization ducts at base of spermathecae (
Fig. 10
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–3.
Antillorena patapata
sp. nov.
1 male (Holotype, IBSP 160903), dorsal view; 2–3 female (Paratype, IBSP 160906); 2 dorsal view, 3 carapace, lateral view.

FIGURES 4–5.
Antillorena patapata
sp. nov. (
Paratype, IBSP 160904). 4 female carapace and chelicerae, frontal view; 5 female labium, endites, sternum and coxae, ventral view.

FIGURES 6.
Antillorena patapata
sp. nov.
, left male palp, expanded (UEFS). Abbreviations: BH: basal hematodocha; Co: conductor; Cy: cymbium; E: embolus; P: projection of cymbium; PTA: proximal tegular apophysis; RTA: retrolateral tibial apophysis; St: subtegulum; T: tegulum; VTA: ventral tegular apophysis.

subSubSection.paragraph: Natural history. The specimens were collected with pitfall traps in the Atlantic Forrest of southern Bahia. Distribution. Known only from the type locality in the state of Bahia, Brazil .
